name: Instant Pot® Beef Bone Broth
author: Bren
summary: Don't toss those beef bones. Freeze them, and when you have 2 pounds make beef broth using your Instant Pot® with minimal prep!
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray
Place beef bones, carrots, celery, onion, and garlic on the prepared baking sheet
Roast in the preheated oven until browned, about 45 minutes
Scrape roasted bones and vegetables into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Add bay leaves, apple cider vinegar, sea salt, peppercorns, and boiling water
Select Manual pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 120 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes
Remove bones and vegetables and discard
Line a strainer with cheesecloth and set over a large bowl
Pour broth through strainer and discard solids
